titleStmt.title: A Character Panygerick or Description of the Legion Clubb on Colledge Green

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I Strole O're the City oft, I,
See a Building Large and Lofty
Not a Bow Shot from the Colledge
Half the Globe from Sense or Knowledge
By the Prudent Architect
Plac'd Against the Church Direct
Making good my Grandams Jest
Nearer the Church You know the Rest
Tell us what this Pile Contains
Many heads that hold no Brains
These Demoniacks let me Dubb
With the Name of Legion Clubb
Such Assemblies you may Swear
Meet when Butchers beat a Bear.
Such a Noise and such harangu'ing
When a Brother theif's a hanging
Such a Rout and Such a Rabble
Run to hear Iack Pudding Gabble
Such a Croud their Ordure Throws
On a fearless Villians Nose
Could I from the building topp
Hear the Rattling thunder drop
While the devil upon the Roof
If the devil be thunder proof
Should with Pokers fiery red
Crack the Stones & Melt the Lead
Drive them down on Every Skull
While the Den of theives is full
Quite Destroy that harpies Nest
How might then our Isle be blest
For Divines allow that god
Sometimes makes the devil his Rod
And the Gospel will Inform us
He can punish Sins Enormous
Yet should Swift Endow ye Schools
for his Lunaticks and fools
with a rood or two of Land
I Allow the Pile might Stand
You Perhaps may ask me why so
But it is with this provisoe
Since the house is Like to Last
Let a Legal grant be past
That the Clubb have right to dwell
Each within his proper Cell
with a passage Left to Creep in
And a hole above to peep in
Let them when they once get in
Sell the Nation for a Pin
While they sit apicking Straws
Let them Rave of making Laws
While they Never hold their Tongue
Let them Dabble in their Dung
Let them form a grand Committee
How to plague and Starve the City
Let them Stare and Storm and frown
When they See a Clergy-Gown
Let them Er'e they crack a Louse
Call for the Order of the house
Let them with their Goslin Quils
Scribble Senseless heads of Bills
We may while they Strain their throats
Wipe our A──es with their Votes
Let Sṛ Tom, that rampant Ass
Stuff his Gutts with flax and Grass
But before the Preist he fleeces
Tear the Bible all in Peices
At the Parson T──m hallow boy
Worthy Offspring of a Shoe boy
Footman Traytor Vile Seducer
Perjur'd Villian Vile Accuser
Lay thy Paultry priviledge Aside
Vile Descendṭ of a Regicide.
Fall a working Like a Mole
Raise a Dirt about your hole
Come Assist \addme\ muse Obedient.
Let us try some new Expedient
Shift the Scene for half an hour
Time and place are in thy power
Thither Gentle Muse Conduct me
I shall Ask and you Instruct me
See the Muse Unbarrs the Gate
Hark the Monkeys how they Prate
All the Gods who Rule the Soul
Styx thr'o hell whose Waters roll
Let Me be Allowed to tell
What I heard in Yonder Cell
Near the door an Entrance Gapes
Crou'ded round with Antick Shapes
Poverty and greif and Care
Causeless Ioy and foul Dispair
Discord Perrywigg'd with Snakes
Mark the Dreadfull Stride she takes
By this Odious crew besett
I Began to Rage and frett,
And Resolv'd to break their pates
Er'e we Enter'd at their Gates
Had not Clio in the Nick
Whisper'd me Let down Your Stick
What said I is this the Madhouse
No said she they are but Shadows
Phantoms Bodiless and Vain
Empty Visions of the Brain
In the Porch Briarius Stands
Shews a Bribe in all his hands
Briarius the Secretary
But we Mortalls call him Cary
When the Rogues their Country fleece
They may hope for Pence apeice
Clio who had been so wise
To put on a fools Disguise
To Bespeak Some Approbation
And be thought a Near Relation
When she saw two hundred Brutes
All Involv'd in wild Disputes
Roaring till their Lungs were Spent
Priviledge of Parliament
Now a New Misfortune feels
Dreading to be Laid by the heels
Never durst a Muse before
Enter that Infernal Door
Clio Stiffled by the Smell
Into Spleen and Vapours fell
By the Infectious Reum that flew
from this Dire Infectious Crew
Nor the Stench of Lake Avernus
Could have More Offended her Nose
Had she flown \add·but\ O're the top
She must feel her Pinions Drop
And by Exhalations Dire
Tho a Goddess must Expire
In a fright she crept Away
Bravely I resolv'd to Stay
When I saw the Keeper frown
Tiping him with half a Crown
Now Said I we are Alone
Name the Hero\del·e·add·'\s One by One
Who is that hell featur'd Brawler
Is it Satan No its Waller
Honest Keeper Drive him further
In his Looks are hell and Murther
In what figure can a bard Dress
Iack the Grandson of Sṛ Hardrass
See his Groveling Visage Drop
Iust as when he Murder'd Throp
Keeper tell me where to fix
On the Puppy Pair of Dicks
By their Lanthorn Iaws and Leathren
You might Swear they both were brethren
Dick Fitzbaker Dick the Player
Old Acquaintance are You there
Dṛ Companions Hugg and Kiss
Toast old Glorious in Your Piss
Fix them Keeper in a Teather
Let them Starve and Stink togethe\hole\
Both are Apt to be Unruly
Lash them Dayly lash them Duely
Tho' ti's hopeless to Reclaim them
Scorpion Rodds Perhaps may tame them
Keeper Yon Old Dotard Smoak
Sweetly Snoreing in his Cloak
Who is he tis humdrum Wynne
Half Encompass'd with his Kinn
There Observe the tribe of Bingham
for he Never fails to bring them
And the base Apostate Vesey
With Bishops Scraps tho' fat & Greasy
While he Sleeps he whole Debate
They Submissive Round him wait
Yet would gladly See the Hunks
In his grave to Search his Trunks
See they gentley touch his Coat
But to Yawn and give his Vote
Always \add·true\ to his Vocation
For the Court against the Nation
Those are Allens Jack and Bobb
First in Every wicked Iobb
Son and brother to a Quere
Brainsick brute they call a Peer
We must give them better Quarter
For their Ancestor trodd Mortar
And at Howth to boast his fame
On a Chimney cutt his Name
There Sitt Clements Dilks & Carter
Who for hell would Dye a Martyr
Such a Triplett could you tell
Where to find on this Side Hell
Gallows Carter Dilks and Clemtṣ
Souse them in their Own Excrements
om.
om.
Every Mischeif's in their Hearts
If they fail \del·i·add·'\tis want of Parts
Bless me Morgan Art thou there man
Bless mine Eyes art thou the Chairman
Chairman to yon Damned Committee
Yet I Look on thee with Pity
Dreadfull Sight what Learned Morgan
Metamorphos'd to a Gorgan
For thy Horrid Looks I own
Half Convert me into Stone
Hast thou been so Long at School
Now to turn a factious fool
Alma Mater was thy Mother
Every Young Divine thy Brother
Thou a Disobedṭ Varlet
Treat thy Mother like a Harlot
Thou Ungratefull to thy Teachers
Who are all grown Revḍ Preachers
Morgan would it not Surprize One
Turn thy Nourishment to Poison
When You walk among Your Books
They reproach you with their Looks
Bind them fast or from their Shelves
They'l come down and write them·selves
Homer Plutarch Virgil flaccus
All in Arms Prepare to back us
Soon repent or Put to Slaughter
Every greek and Roman Author
Will You in your factious Phrase
Send the Clergy all to graze
And to make your Projects pass
Leave them not a blade of Grass
How I want the humourous Hogart
Thou I hear a pleasant Rogue Art
Were but you and I Acquainted
Every monster should be painted
You should try your grav'ing tools
on this odious troop of fools
Draw them (large) as I Describe them
from their features while I gibe them
Draw them Like for I Assure You
You will Need no Charactura
Draw them so that we may trace
All the Soul in Every face
Keeper Now I must Retire
You have done what I Desire
But I feel my Spirit Spent
With the Noise the Sight the Scent
Pray be Patient You shall find
Half the best are Still behind
You have hardly Seen a Score
I can Show two hundred More
Keeper I have Seen Enough
Taking then a Pinch of Snuff
I Concluded Looking round them
May their god the Devil Confound them
Except the Glorious fifty two
To whom Jmmortall honours due
om.
om.
